title: Software Developer, India
description:
**At AlgoSec, what you do matters!**
 Over 2,200 of the world‚Äôs leading organizations trust AlgoSec to help secure their most critical workloads across public cloud, private cloud, containers, and on\\-premises networks.
   

  

 Join our global team, securing application connectivity, anywhere.
   

  

 We are hiring a Software Developer to join our Customer Focus R\\&D team.
   

  

**Reporting to:** 
 R\\&D Customer Focus Team Leader
   

  

**Location:** 
 Gurgaon, India
   

  

**Direct Employment**
**Responsibilities**
* Join a special and dynamic development team, solving complex issues seen in the field. Daily interaction with other development teams, technical services, and QA.
* Use profilers, debuggers, other tools and ‚Äúout of the box‚Äù thinking to improve component performance and scalability.
* Work with a wide range of technologies \\& systems such as Java, microservices, Spring, Perl, Linux, AWS infrastructure, Angular, PostgreSQL, ActiveMQ, and more.
* Become familiar with the entire AlgoSec suite and the underlying codebase while contributing to training and performing knowledge transfers within the company.


**Requirements**
* Graduated with an elite university (IIT, NIT) with excellence.
* Knowledge in software development (Java).
* At least 5 years of experience in Java software development.
* Team player, pleasant person to work with, high level of integrity.
* Fast learner, bright, independent and organized.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


**Advantages**
* Experience in any of the following technologies: Spring Boot applications, Hibernate, JPA, concurrency, Perl, C, PHP, Ruby, Angular, AWS cloud development‚ÄØand networking.
* Knowledge in Linux/UNIX environments.
* Multitasking, "out\\-of\\-the\\-box" thinking and problem\\-solving abilities.
* Experience with full stack troubleshooting and providing support for enterprise applications.
* Experience in customer\\-facing roles, working with enterprise customers.
* Previous experience in the security space.


 AlgoSec is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO), committed to creating a friendly, diverse and inclusive company culture.

title: Web and app developer intern
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Zeretail is revolutionizing the way micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs), restaurants, and retailers in India procure daily essentials. As a leading B2B quick commerce platform, we deliver a wide range of products, including fresh produce, groceries, packaging materials, and cleaning supplies, all in one convenient platform. Leveraging AI technology, Zeretail not only fulfills orders but also empowers businesses to grow by recommending products, predicting inventory needs, and streamlining procurement processes. We are committed to ensuring uninterrupted operations for our clients, helping them focus on serving their customers.
   

  

**Role Description**
  

 We are looking for a Web and App Developer Intern to join our dynamic team in a hybrid capacity, with a base location in Gurugram and flexibility for remote work. This is a full\\-time role where you will assist in designing, coding, and testing web and mobile applications. Your responsibilities will include developing software, integrating databases, writing clean and efficient code, ensuring seamless functionality, and troubleshooting technical issues. Collaboration with cross\\-functional teams to enhance system performance and build effective solutions will be a key part of your role.
   

  

**Qualifications**
  

* Proficiency in Software Development and Programming
* Experience with Databases and database management
* Knowledge of Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) for design and layout purposes
* Understanding of system Integration processes
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and attention to detail
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team and adapt to a hybrid working environment
* Familiarity with app development frameworks and tools is a plus
* Currently pursuing or recently graduated with a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field

title: Software Engineering- Development
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission\\-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward ‚Äì always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Senior Linux Devops engineer, responsible for planning and implementing complex Linux projects. You lead system hardening, security, and compliance initiatives. You are also an advocate for cloud solutions and can mentor others effectively.
   

  

 Key Skills:
   

  

 10\\+ years of Mastery of Linux Server technologies.
   

  

 Leadership in system hardening, security, and compliance.
   

  

 Strong understanding of cloud solutions and architecture
   

  

 Expertise in Ansible Automation, Azure CICD Pipelines, Packers
   

  

 Expertise in Yaml and Python scripting
   

  

 Leadership in planning and executing Linux projects.
   

  

 Mentorship and knowledge sharing with the team.
   

  

 Strong critical thinking and problem\\-solving skills.
   

  

 Effective communication, including presenting to stakeholders.
   

  

 Certifications:
   

  

 RHSCA (EX200\\)
   

  

 RHCE (EX294\\)
   

  

 RHCA
   

  

 EX467
   

  

 AZ400
   

  

 AZ304
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Graduate degree
   

  

**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it‚Äôs how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we‚Äôre not doing it single\\-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you ‚Äì and everyone next to you ‚Äì the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That‚Äôs the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state\\-of\\-the\\-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well\\-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter ‚Äì wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company\\-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non\\-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‚ÄòHow Did You Hear About Us‚Äô during the application process, select ‚ÄòEmployee Referral‚Äô and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Google Apps Script Automation Specialist
description:
We‚Äôre Hiring: Google Apps Script Automation Developer (Freelance)
 



  





 Work Type: Remote \\| Hours: 5 hrs/day (Monday to Saturday) \\| Experience: 1‚Äì5 Years
 



  





**Company Description** 




  





**BioQubiit AutoZen LLP** 
 is a leading innovator in Automation and AI solutions, shaping the future of work through advanced, scalable technologies. Serving clients across India, the US, the UK, Germany, and other global markets, we help businesses modernize operations by transforming traditional workflows into high\\-efficiency, automated processes. With extensive expertise in process automation, AI\\-driven insights, and end\\-to\\-end enterprise solutions, BioQubiit AutoZen delivers results that enhance productivity, accuracy, and growth. We focus on creating impactful solutions, such as AI\\-powered CRM systems, intelligent HR applications, and AI document generators, to help organizations reduce complexity, optimize workflows, and focus on innovation.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a remote contract role for a Google Apps Script Automation Developer. The successful candidate will develop, test, and deploy custom Google Workspace (G Suite) integrations and solutions using Google Apps Script. Responsibilities include designing and implementing automation solutions, optimizing Google Workspace workflows, maintaining and troubleshooting existing scripts, and collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements. Additionally, the role includes documenting created solutions and providing necessary support to end\\-users.
 



  





  





 We‚Äôre looking for a creative problem\\-solver who can work independently and deliver smart, scalable automation workflows using Google Apps Script.
 



  





 What You‚Äôll Do:
 



 ‚úÖ Build and customize automation solutions across Google Sheets, Docs, Forms, Gmail, etc.
 



 ‚úÖ Design end\\-to\\-end workflows to optimize business processes.
 



 ‚úÖ Troubleshoot and provide innovative solutions for complex challenges.
 



 ‚úÖ Collaborate with stakeholders and present demos when required.
 



  





 What We‚Äôre Looking For:
 



 ‚úî Strong expertise in Google Apps Script and Google Workspace APIs.
 



 ‚úî Ability to think out of the box and work independently.
 



 ‚úî Experience in automation design, scripting, and API integrations.
 



 ‚úî Excellent problem\\-solving and communication skills.
 



  





 Must Have:
 



 üíª A laptop in good working condition
 



 üåê Reliable high\\-speed internet
 



 ‚è± Ability to dedicate 5 hours daily on weekdays
 



  





 Nice to Have:
 



  





 Experience in senior\\-level automation roles.
 



 Knowledge of Business Process Automation (BPA) and workflow design.
 



 Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
 



 üì© Apply Now: Send your resume and portfolio to hr@bioqubiitautozen.io
 



 üí¨ Availability: Must attend virtual meetings on weekdays.

title: Mainframe MQ System Programmer
job_function: Project Management, Information Technology, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission\\-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward ‚Äì always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a System Administrator at Kyndryl, you‚Äôll solve complex problems and identify potential future issues across the spectrum of platforms and services. You‚Äôll be at the forefront of new technology and modernization, working with some of our biggest clients ‚Äì which means some of the biggest in the world.
   

  

 There‚Äôs never a typical day as a System Administrator at Kyndryl, because no two projects are alike. You‚Äôll be managing systems data for clients and providing day\\-to\\-day solutions and security compliance. You‚Äôll oversee a queue of assignments and work directly with technicians, prioritizing tickets to deliver the best solutions to our clients.
   

  

 One of the benefits of Kyndryl is that we work with clients in a variety of industries, from banking to retail. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here. You‚Äôll also get the chance to share your expertise by recommending modernization options, identifying new business opportunities, and cultivating relationships with other teams and stakeholders. Does the work get challenging at times? Yes! But you‚Äôll collaborate with a diverse group of talented people and gain invaluable management and organizational skills, which will come in handy as you move forward in your career.
   

  

 Your future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career, from Junior System Administrator to Architect. We have opportunities for Cloud Hyperscalers that you won‚Äôt find anywhere else, including hands\\-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. One of the benefits of Kyndryl is that we work with clients in a variety of industries, from banking to retail. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You‚Äôre good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important ‚Äì you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer\\-focused ‚Äì someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you‚Äôre open and borderless ‚Äì naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* 8\\+ Years of experience in Mainframe MQ System Programming.
* Expertise in MQ for z/OS installation and upgrades (ShopzSeries, SMP/E).
* Strong troubleshooting skills using MQ command line and monitoring tools.
* Experience with MQ Explorer, Tivoli, Omegamon, SYSVIEW, BMC MainView, MQATTACH, ICC.
* Knowledge of security configurations, workload management, and automation scripting.
* Install, configure, and maintain WMQ and associated system software.
* Monitor system performance \\& availability, implementing necessary tuning.
* Perform system backups, recovery, and troubleshooting for MQ issues.
* Develop automation scripts for monitoring, alerting, and issue resolution.
* Ensure security compliance and implement security best practices for MQ.
* Design clustering and workload balancing for high availability.
* Support on\\-call rotations for extended\\-hour coverage.


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or a related field.
* MQ upgrade from one version to another version in z/os.
* Administration of various MQ objects in Mainframe MQ.


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it‚Äôs how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we‚Äôre not doing it single\\-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you ‚Äì and everyone next to you ‚Äì the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That‚Äôs the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state\\-of\\-the\\-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well\\-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter ‚Äì wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company\\-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non\\-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‚ÄòHow Did You Hear About Us‚Äô during the application process, select ‚ÄòEmployee Referral‚Äô and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

 Your future at Kyndryl

**Who You Are**
 You‚Äôre good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. You are customer\\-focused ‚Äì someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you‚Äôre open and borderless ‚Äì naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Technical And Professional Expertise**
* 8 to 14 Years of experience in CICS system programming.

* Develop, document and maintain procedures for system utilities such as backup/restore, performance tuning and configuration of environments.


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it‚Äôs how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we‚Äôre not doing it single\\-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you ‚Äì and everyone next to you ‚Äì the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That‚Äôs the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state\\-of\\-the\\-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well\\-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter ‚Äì wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company\\-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non\\-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‚ÄòHow Did You Hear About Us‚Äô during the application process, select ‚ÄòEmployee Referral‚Äô and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Software Engineer ‚Äì Automation Trainee
description:
**Company Description**
  

 At Geon, we blend innovation and sustainability to activate green energy solutions for a better future. Our mission is to empower communities by integrating advanced technologies with environmental responsibility. We are committed to driving a sustainable future where green energy becomes the standard for global communities, fostering impactful change. By aligning technology with eco\\-friendly practices, Geon is dedicated to creating lasting value for both society and the environment.
   

  

**Role Description**
  

 This is a full\\-time, on\\-site role located in Daman, for a Software Engineer ‚Äì Automation Trainee. In this role, you will be responsible for developing, testing, and maintaining innovative software solutions with a focus on automation. Your key tasks will include developing back\\-end functionalities, writing and debugging software code, and applying object\\-oriented programming principles. You will collaborate with a team of engineers to execute projects efficiently, ensuring high\\-quality performance and scalability of applications.
   

  

**Qualifications**
  

* Strong foundation in Computer Science principles and concepts
* Proficiency in Back\\-End Web Development and Software Development
* Experience in Programming and Object\\-Oriented Programming (OOP)
* An analytical mindset and problem\\-solving skills

* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
* Familiarity with automation technologies or tools is an advantage
